skills.name: Find the absolute value of a number
Compare absolute values using inequality notation
Use absolute values to compare and order rational numbers

explanations.A: Remember that |x| notation means absolute value, so here we are comparing how far away the numbers are from 0 rather than the numbers themselves.
explanations.B: |x| means absolute value, so we are comparing how far away each number is from 0. 8 is closest to 0, then 14, then 20, and then 21 2/3.
explanations.C: I think you may have ordered them from greatest to least rather than least to greatest!
explanations.D: Remember that |x| notation means absolute value, so here we are comparing how far away the numbers are from 0 rather than the numbers themselves.

explanations.A: Remember that |x| notation means absolute value, so here we are comparing how far away the numbers are from 0 rather than the numbers themselves.
explanations.B: |x| means absolute value, so we are comparing how far away each number is from 0. 4 is closest to 0, then -5, then 10, and then -16 1/3.
explanations.C: I think you may have ordered them from greatest to least rather than least to greatest!
explanations.D: Remember that |x| notation means absolute value, so here we are comparing how far away the numbers are from 0 rather than the numbers themselves.

explanations.A: It looks like you have given the largest positive value but remember that absolute value means how far the number is away from 0! Which of the values is furthest away from 0?
explanations.B: It seems like you have given the number closest to 0, however absolute value means how far away something is from 0!
explanations.C: Remember that absolute value means how far away the numbers are from 0 for any positive or negative number.
explanations.D: -5 is the furthest away from 0 with an absolute value of 5.

explanations.A: It seems like you have given the number closest to 0, however absolute value means how far away something is from 0!
explanations.B: Remember that absolute value means how far away the numbers are from 0 for any positive or negative number.
explanations.C: It looks like you have given the largest positive value but remember that absolute value means how far the number is away from 0! Which of the values is furthest away from 0?
explanations.D: -4.5 is the furthest away from 0 with an absolute value of 4.5.

explanations.A: Not quite - if we compare the number of tenths 9.8 and 9.75 have, which one has more?
explanations.B: |x| means absolute value, so we are comparing how far away each number is from 0 rather than the actual numbers themselves.
explanations.C: |x| means absolute value, so we are comparing how far away each number is from 0 rather than the actual numbers themselves.
explanations.D: -10.2 has an absolute value of 10.2, which is bigger than 9.8.

explanations.A: |x| means absolute value, so we are comparing how far away each number is from 0 rather than the actual numbers themselves.
explanations.B: -10.2 has an absolute value of 10.2, which is greater than the absolute value of -6.2 which is 6.2.
explanations.C: Not quite - if we compare the number of tenths 6.2 and 6.15 have, which one has more?
explanations.D: |x| means absolute value, so we are comparing how far away each number is from 0 rather than the actual numbers themselves.

explanations.A: Remember that absolute value means how far the number is away from 0. We are trying to work out which number has the smallest distance from 0.
explanations.B: Remember that absolute value means how far the number is away from 0. We are trying to work out which number has the smallest distance from 0.
explanations.C: 4 has the smallest absolute value as it is only 4 away from 0.
explanations.D: Absolute value means how far away a positive or negative number is from 0. 16 is actually the furthest from 0 here so has the biggest absolute value!

explanations.A: 4 has the smallest absolute value as it is only 4 away from 0.
explanations.B: Absolute value means how far away a positive or negative number is from 0. The absolute value of 12 is 12, which isn't the smallest one here!
explanations.C: Remember that absolute value means how far the number is away from 0. We are trying to work out which number has the smallest distance from 0.
explanations.D: Remember that absolute value means how far the number is away from 0. We are trying to work out which number has the smallest distance from 0 rather than which is the smallest number.

explanations.A: |x| means absolute value, the distance away from 0. The absolute value of -5 is 5 and the absolute value of -6 is 6, so |-6| would actually be greater than |-5| .
explanations.B: It seems you've given a number that has a greater value than the absolute value of -5! Remember < means less than.
explanations.C: It looks like you have just given the absolute value of -5, which means that it would be equal (=) instead of less than (<).
explanations.D: -6 is less than the absolute value of -5 which is 5.

explanations.A: -9 is less than the absolute value of -8 which is 8.
explanations.B: It looks like you have just given the absolute value of -8, which means that it would be equal (=) instead of less than (<).
explanations.C: |x| means absolute value, the distance away from 0. The absolute value of -8 is 8 and the absolute value of -9 is 9, so |-9| would actually be greater than |-8| .
explanations.D: It seems you've given a number that has a greater value than the absolute value of -8! Remember < means less than.
